intro: Jacea haynaldii, commonly known as the Haynald's jacea, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss. Jacea haynaldii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
